abstract: Bronx librarian Colbert Nembhard travels weekly to Crotona Inn homeless shelter where he reads and sings to children; Nembhard's partnership with shelter serves as model for citywide initiative, which places small libraries at shelters across New York City, and allows books to become daily part of homeless children's lives.

headline.print_headline: Devoted to Teaching Homeless Children a Lasting Love of Books
headline.main: A Bronx Librarian Keen on Teaching Homeless Children a Lasting Love of Books

snippet: Every Wednesday, Colbert Nembhard visits the Crotona Inn shelter, serving as a model for a New York City literacy effort geared toward boys and girls living in transient conditions....
lead_paragraph: Every Wednesday, Colbert Nembhard visits the Crotona Inn shelter, serving as a model for a New York City literacy effort geared toward boys and girls living in transient conditions.
